text.p: - Russian border guards in Dagestan have failed to smash the local caviar mafia which is suspected of involvement in a fatal explosion that killed more than 50 people last month.

- A new plans for military reform in Russia, drafted by a group of General Staff officers, is based on the assumpsion that Russia would be unable to wage a war on a global scale and would never prepare for such a war.
- Viktor Chernomyrdin's speach yesterday to the Federation Council, the upper chamber of parliament, eased tension between the prime minister and regional leaders represented in the parliament.
- Russia's gas giant Gazprom has decided to cut deliveries to Belarus in an apparent move to pay overdue taxes to the state budget.
- The Chechen separatist leaders' actions seem logical and consistent, whereas Russia's leadership policy remains ill-planned.
- If the so-called moderate Chechen leaders win elections in the breakaway republic, they may easily turn into radicals.
- The situation in the country is dramatic now. We have a bankrupt state, ill president, weak-willed government and powerless parliament, says Gennady Zyuganov, the leader of Russia's communists.

- A test conducted in an American laboratory has proved that the tape of the allegedly bugged and controversial telephone conversation between President presidential aides Anatoly Chubais and Viktor Ilyushin, which referes to cash payments during the presidential election campaign, is authentic, the daily says.
